page.title: 16KILSYTH TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content: The telephone exchange was opened on 30th June 1971. It is a TXE2 electronic exchange which replaced an earlier STROWGER exchange(so called after its Kansas inventor). It has 5000 lines,4200 of which are in use just now. There is to be a digital telephone exchange built in Queenzieburn in two to three years time . In the future if you were going out you could phone the exchange and tell them not to allow any more calls. When you got back you could phone the exchange which would recognise your voice and free the telephone. You might tape a message if you were going away. The exchange would pass on the message at whatever time you wanted.
